before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"an7s3","text":"It is recommended to use to the forward flow principle to avoid contamination. All mastermixes should be made in a mastermix cabinet and aliquoted . Samples should be added in the extraction and sample cabinet. Amplicons should be purified in a post-PCR cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":180,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":242,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhgcv","text":"Mastermix, extraction and sample and post-PCR cabinet should be cleaned with appropriate disinfectant and UV-sterilized before and after use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7gmmp","text":"This SOP describes the procedure for generating cDNA from respiratory syncytial virus A or B (RSVA or RSVB) viral nucleic acid extracts and subsequently producing ~400nt amplicons tiling the viral genome in a multiplex PCR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ikal","text":"The resulting products can be sequenced using short (Illumina) or long (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) reads approaches.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kl27","text":"The panels and files for bioinformatic analysis are available at:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ob16","text":"https://github.com/SimonLoriereLab/RSV_amplicons_panels","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":55}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"72CE821F99D444E784AE8B4F1E9D5FF6","url":"https://github.com/SimonLoriereLab/RSV_amplicons_panels"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"c64ge","text":"The panels have been optimized using RSV A or RSV B positive samples circulating in Europe in 2018-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sg9n","text":"2022. Processing samples from previous years or from regions outside of Europe might require","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99dv2","text":"further adjustments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8b8bv","text":"Primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3otaj","text":"Primer schemes for RSVA and RSVB have been designed and optimized to cover the diversity of viruses circulating in the Northern hemisphere (2018-2023). Processing samples from previous years or from regions outside of Europe might require","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kq6q","text":"further adjustments. See the file below for primer sequences and their ratio.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bosqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3csep","text":"We work with typed samples, but it may be possible to combine the panels for A and B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mc65","text":"Multiple assays are available for typing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58bip","text":"(1) Todd A et al, J Virol Methods, 2021 - Rapid detection of human respiratory syncytial virus A and B by duplex real-time RT-PCR. doi:10.1016/j.jviromet.2021.114171","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49peu","text":"(2) Wang et al, J Virol Methods, 2019 - Duplex real-time RT-PCR assay for detection and subgroup-specific identification of human respiratory syncytial virus. doi: 10.1016/j.jviromet.2019.113676","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cj0i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1aj8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a8ih","text":"Other panels, including a panel compatible with both RSVA and RSVB have been developed: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nr8l","text":"Dong et al, J Clin Virol, 2023 - A simplified, amplicon-based method for whole genome sequencing of human respiratory syncytial viruses. doi: 10.1016/j.jcv.2023.105423","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ampi5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ej2n","text":"Primers may be ordered from any oligonucleotide company. For primer preparation instructions see Step 5 of the protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh5db","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a5pc","text":"Consumables","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c99s","text":"Filtered pipette tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f2a7","text":"1.5 and 2mL microcentrifuge tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1vu1","text":"15 and 50 mL Falcon tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c11vg","text":"8-strip PCR tubes or PCR plates with caps or heat-sealing film","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3i66","text":"Reservoirs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vb8u","text":"Waste containers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n6g6","text":"Magnetic rack for PCR tubes or 96w plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hvpo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd4ps","text":"Molecular Biology","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p07g","text":"LunaScript RT SuperMix, M3010X, NEB - or equivalent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq2pu","text":"Q5 High Fidelity DNA polymerase, M0491L, NEB","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1q5a","text":"dNTP Mix 10MM, 10319879, Thermo Fisher Scientific","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c10cj","text":"Agencourt AMPure beads XP, A63880, Beckman Coulter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bboqj","text":"Nuclease Free Water, 10526945, Thermo Fisher Scientific","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vhnk","text":"Qubit dsDNA HS Assay kit, Q32854, Thermo Fisher Scientific","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffd95","text":"The following steps should be performed in a post-PCR cabinet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":62},{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51bnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cop1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asbep","text":"Combine the entire contents of Pool 1 and Pool 2 PCR reactions for each biological sample into a single tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"676m1","text":"Quantify the DNA concentration using the Qubit High Sensitivity DNA kit (or equivalent) from 1 μL of each product.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ee6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62kf8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f2goj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2flc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4bnk9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41066F3F341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Qubit® dsDNA HS Assay Kit","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"Q32854","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/Q32854","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific"}}},"1":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"14lon","text":"Expected range = 10-100 ng/μL DNA.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fplrj","text":"The PCR products can be used to prepare libraries for short or long reads sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65bh5","text":"Sample selection:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ceqj","text":"Viral RNA input from a clinical sample (recommended Ct value below 28).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbd4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tudp","text":"It is recommended to dilute high viral load samples (below Ct 14-15) to reduce the likelihood of PCR inhibition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
